string-array.name: string_array_fun_facts_text
string-array.item: The Department of Computer Science was founded in 1973
The first computing courses were offered in 1974
The School of Computing and Mathematical Sciences was founded in 1987
The first students to graduate with a Bachelor of Computing and Mathematical Sciences (BCMS) graduated in 1989
The official opening of G Block by Geoffrey Palmer, Prime Minister of New Zealand, took place in 1990.
In 1993 we began teaching computer science in te reo Māori with 0657.113 Ngā Tautono Rorohiko
In 2002 Design joined the School of Computing Mathematical Sciences with the Bachelor of Computer Graphic Design (BCGD)
